meanings.definition: To become steeper or more inclined.
meanings.sent1: The hill was steepening as we climbed higher.
meanings.sent2: The road was steepening as it approached the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The slope seemed to be steepening just to challenge us.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was steepening like a mountain path ahead.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays steepening the shadows on the hillside made it look even more daunting.

meanings.definition: The act of making something steeper or more inclined.
meanings.sent1: The steepening of the staircase made it harder to climb.
meanings.sent2: The architect's design included a gradual steepening of the roof.
meanings.sent3: The sudden steepening of the ski slope caught the skiers off guard.
meanings.sent4: The steepening of the riverbank was necessary to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent5: The gradual steepening of the path added an element of challenge to the hike.
